info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 4:22PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF OHIO, SOUTHEASTERN RIPLEY, SOUTHWESTERN DEARBORN AND NORTHWESTERN SWITZERLAND COUNTIES THROUGH 445 PM EDT... At 421 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located 9 miles north of Vevay. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, half inch hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Pleasant, Fairview, Center Square, Aberdeen, Avonburg, Farmers Retreat, Bear Branch, Friendship, East Enterprise, Allensville, Quercus Grove, Mount Sterling and Jacksonville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
